results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 4
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Hamish from Hawthorn talking about his Game Boy; Mike from Montrose and his keyring; Melissa from East Malvern adores her Dogs; The Monroe Family show us ‘Fairy Ted’ and a geometry book; Atlanta from Abbotsford recalls an idyllic spot called ‘Warm Baths’; Nicholas from Doncaster East follows sports - a lot; Seth from both Istanbul and Ivanhoe talks about sailing; and Isobel from Hawthorn shows us her CareBears

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 3
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment has David from Birregurra talking about his new Motorbike; Paul, Louise, Ella and Matthew show us a Duck and Mr Pumpkin Head; Lucy from Perth shares a Poem; Alisha and Anna from Canterbury talk about Teddy Sascha and Alisha; Mary from Watsonia explains her passion for her horse; Mark and Liz talk about their kids; and Danielle from Melbourne discusses her favourite film ‘Chopper’.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 2
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Annemaree and Doug from Hawthorn telling us about the significance of her rings and his passion for AFL Footy; Emily, John and Raj talk about ‘favourite friends’; Kate from Elwood tells us about Elephant; Christy from Elwood loves her Edward B. Bear and Anthony shows us his favourite party trick

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 11
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Kenton from Nundawading who just loves life and the state of Victoria; a woman who has four deeply meaningful Rings; Nairee and Michelle from Traralgon tell us about ‘my dog Oscar’; and Adrian from Brunswick has a passion for Melbourne’s live music scene.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 1
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Norma from Swan Hill talking about a Mallee root; Alex from Melbourne discusses 19th century literature; Adam Elliott is still thrilled by his Oscar; Lewis loves the Spy Kids movies; Alfred of Reservoir tells us that retirement is his favourite thing and a visitor from Hong Kong bursts into song!

results.title: Victoria's favourite things
results.brief_description:
Check out what people brought to ACMI for July’s Open House weekend program
‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. Recorded live in ACMI’s Screen Pit, the event was modelled on a 1960’s variety show and includes songs, stories, bad jokes and some really interesting stuff.

results.title: Victoria's Energy
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Victoria’s energy” uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

See also Related Title “Energy conservation in the home” which provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

results.title: Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Rich in history and culture, Victoria also boasts a fine selection of food and spectacular natural landscapes. Melbourne’s main attractions open the program including trams, tree-lined boulevards, splendid buildings and magnificent gardens. Its country and coastal regions offer visitors a diverse range of activities from horse riding in the Great Dividing Ranges, experiencing the gold rush at Sovereign Hill, ‘cruising’ Lake Eildon, visiting Flagstaff Hill Maritime Museum, relaxing at Daylesford and Hepburn Springs, rock-climbing at Mount Arapiles and for the gourmet traveller a residential cooking school at Howqua Dale.

results.title: Victor/Victoria
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Tony Adams, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Ladbroke Entertainment
results.brief_description: Sparkling, ultra-sophisticated entertainment from Blake Edwards. This story is based on a 1933 German comedy film “Viktor und Viktoria” written and directed by Rheinhold Schunzel. Set in Paris in 1934, it is the tale of a down-on-her luck chanteuse, played by Julie Andrews. Also suffering a temporary career lapse is tres gai nightclub entertainer (Robert Preston), who remakes her as a man who in short order becomes celebrated as Paris’s foremost female impersonator. In the process she snags the attentions of a Chicago nightclub owner (James Garner). He, however, has a small problem - is it a he or a she who has stolen his heart? 1982 Academy Award for Best Original Score (Henry Mancini). Academy Award nominations for Best Actress (Julie Andrews), Supporting Actor (Robert Preston), Supporting Actress (Lesley Anne Warren), Screenplay Adaptation, Costume Design and Art Direction.
